message_1: Suppose you have a message "HELLO" which needs to be encrypted using One-time pad encryption. The randomly generated key for the message is "JSCRM". What is the encrypted form of the message using One-time pad encryption? (Hint: Convert the message and key into numbers using their ASCII representations, add them modulo 26, and convert the result back to letters using their corresponding ASCII characters.)
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO" using the one-time pad key "JSCRM", we will follow these steps:

1. Convert the message and key into numbers using their ASCII representations.
2. Add the corresponding numbers modulo 26.
3. Convert the result back to letters using their corresponding ASCII characters.

Step 1: Convert to ASCII numbers
Message: HELLO -> 7 4 11 11 14 (A=0, B=1, C=2, ..., Z=25)
Key: JSCRM -> 9 18 2 17 12

Step 2: Add modulo 26
(7+9) % 26 = 16
(4+18) % 26 = 22
(11+2) % 26 = 13
(11+17) % 26 = 2
(14+12) % 26 = 0

Step 3: Convert back to letters
16 22 13 2 0 -> QWMCA

The encrypted form of the message "HELLO" using the one-time pad key "JSCRM" is "QWMCA".
